item.title: 关于阿达尼在美国的贿赂起诉，您需要了解什么？
item.description: 印度亿万富翁高塔姆-阿达尼（Gautam Adani）因涉嫌参与一项价值 2.65 亿美元的贿赂印度官员计划而被美国检方起诉，这在他同名的价值 1,420 亿美元的从港口到大豆的商业集团中引起了震动。【原文：Indian billionaire Gautam Adani has been indicted by U.S. prosecutors for his alleged role in a $265 million scheme to bribe Indian officials, sending shockwaves across his eponymous $142 billion ports-to-soybeans business conglomerate.】

item.title: 从澳大利亚到以色列，阿达尼集团的项目遍布全球
item.description: 在阿达尼集团创始人高塔姆-阿达尼（Gautam Adani）因涉嫌参与一项价值 2.65 亿美元的贿赂计划而被美国检察官起诉后，阿达尼集团在肯尼亚的两个主要项目被取消。【原文：Two major Adani Group projects in Kenya were scuttled after its founder Gautam Adani was indicted by U.S. prosecutors over his alleged role in a $265 million bribery scheme - allegations that his conglomerate has denied.】

item.title: 比特币屡创新高，目标直指 10 万美元
item.description: 周五，比特币触及历史新高，目标直指 100,000 美元大关，这是对唐纳德-特朗普政府执政后监管环境将更加友好的预期引发的加密货币大涨。【原文：Bitcoin touched a fresh record high on Friday, with its sights set firmly on the $100,000 barrier, in a stellar rally for the cryptocurrency sparked by expectations of a more friendly regulatory environment under a Donald Trump administration.】

item.title: 得克萨斯州州长下令州政府机构剥离中国资产
item.description: 得克萨斯州共和党州长格雷格-阿博特（Greg Abbott）以金融和安全风险为由，下令州政府机构停止将州政府资金投资于中国，并在第一时间出售。【原文：Republican Governor of Texas Greg Abbott ordered state agencies to cease investing state funds in China and sell at the first available opportunity, citing financial and security risks.】

item.title: 消息人士称，美国起诉后全球银行考虑停止向印度阿达尼公司提供新贷款
item.description: 消息人士称，在美国检察官以欺诈罪起诉印度阿达尼集团的亿万富翁创始人高塔姆-阿达尼（Gautam Adani）后，一些全球银行正在考虑暂时停止向该集团提供新的信贷，但继续保留现有贷款。【原文：Some global banks are considering temporarily halting fresh credit to India's Adani Group but staying put with existing loans following U.S. prosecutors' indictment of its billionaire founder Gautam Adani for fraud, sources said.】

item.title: 贝恩支持的 Kioxia 将在首次公开募股中融资 6.46 亿美元
item.description: 根据周五提交的一份监管文件，贝恩资本（Bain Capital）支持的 Kioxia 将在该芯片制造商的首次公开募股中募集 1000 亿日元（约合 6.4545 亿美元），不包括超额配售。【原文：Bain Capital-backed Kioxia is to raise 100 billion yen ($645.45 million) excluding overallotment in the chipmaker's initial public offering, according to a regulatory filing on Friday.】

item.title: 阿达尼澳大利亚煤炭公司面临人权投诉
item.description: 印度阿达尼集团（Adani Group）的亿万富翁董事长因欺诈被美国检察官起诉，在一个原住民团体向该国人权委员会提出投诉后，该集团在澳大利亚的煤炭部门正面临种族主义指控。【原文：India's Adani Group, whose billionaire chairman has been indicted for fraud by U.S. prosecutors, is facing accusations of racism at its Australian coal unit after an Aboriginal group filed a complaint with the country's Human Rights Commission.】

item.title: 早间竞价PMI迫在眉睫，比特币观望会持续升温
item.description: 安库尔-班纳吉（Ankur Banerjee）对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Ankur Banerjee】

item.title: 摩根士丹利在新加坡设立新的东南亚总部
item.description: 摩根士丹利（Morgan Stanley）表示，本周在新加坡繁华的市中心商业区开设了新的东南亚总部。【原文：Morgan Stanley said it opened its new Southeast Asia headquarters in Singapore's swanky downtown business district this week.】

item.title: 美国起诉阿达尼创始人后，标普下调阿达尼旗下三家公司评级展望
item.description: S&P 全球评级公司周五将阿达尼集团三家实体的评级展望从 "稳定 "下调至 "负面"，理由是该集团的亿万富翁、创始人高塔姆-阿达尼（Gautam Adani）因贿赂指控被美国起诉后，融资渠道面临风险。【原文：S&P Global Ratings lowered its outlook on three Adani Group entities to negative from stable on Friday, citing risks to funding access following a U.S. indictment of the conglomerate's billionaire founder, Gautam Adani, on bribery charges.】

item.title: 大多数分析师表示，随着日元走软和特朗普的回归，日本央行将在 12 月加息：路透调查
item.description: 路透社的一项民意调查显示，超过半数的经济学家认为，日本央行将在 12 月的会议上再次加息，原因是经济走强和对日元贬值的担忧促使决策者采取行动。【原文：The Bank of Japan will raise interest rates again at its December meeting as a strengthening economy and concerns over the depreciating yen prompt policymakers to act, according to just over half of economists in a Reuters poll.】

item.title: 据英国《金融时报》报道，F1 与 ESPN 就下一份美国媒体转播权协议展开谈判
item.description: 英国《金融时报》周四称，在现有合同还剩一年的情况下，一级方程式赛车已开始与转播商 ESPN 就下一份美国媒体转播权协议进行谈判。【原文：Formula One has opened negotiations with broadcaster ESPN over its next U.S. media rights deal with one year left on the existing contract, the Financial Times said on Thursday.】

item.title: 美国起诉后阿达尼集团公司股价连续第二个交易日下跌
item.description: 阿达尼集团公司的股价周五连续第二天下跌，此前美国检方指控这家印度企业集团的亿万富翁董事长涉嫌贿赂和欺诈。【原文：Adani Group companies' shares fell for a second straight day on Friday after U.S. prosecutors charged the Indian conglomerate's billionaire chairman in an alleged bribery and fraud scheme.】

item.title: 东京 11 月通胀率可能再次超过日本央行 2% 的目标：路透社民意调查
item.description: 路透社周五的一项民意调查显示，在燃料补贴减少、食品成本增加的情况下，东京 11 月份的消费者通胀率很可能超过日本央行设定的 2% 的物价目标。【原文：Consumer inflation in Tokyo for November likely surpassed the Bank of Japan's 2% price target following a reduction in fuel subsidies and with an increase in food costs, a Reuters poll showed on Friday.】

item.title: 华尔街日报》报道：特朗普考虑让沃什出任财政部长，之后再担任美联储主席
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周四援引知情人士的话报道，美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普提出了任命凯文-沃什（Kevin Warsh）为财政部长的想法，条件是他日后可能担任美联储主席。【原文：U.S. President-elect Donald Trump floated the idea of appointing Kevin Warsh as Treasury Secretary on the understanding that he could later be Federal Reserve Chairman, the Wall Street Journal reported on Thursday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 参议员称疑似与中国有关的黑客攻击美国电信史上最严重
item.description: 参议院情报委员会主席周四告诉《华盛顿邮报》，美国称与中国有关的电信公司入侵事件是 "迄今为止我国历史上最严重的电信黑客攻击"。【原文：A breach of telecoms companies that the United States said was linked to China was the "worst telecom hack in our nation's history - by far", the chairman of the Senate Intelligence Committee told the Washington Post on Thursday.】

item.title: 中国称稳定的中美经贸发展对两国都有利
item.description: 中国商务部副部长王受文周五表示，中美经贸关系的稳定和可持续发展趋势将使两国受益。【原文：A stable and sustainable development trend on trade and business matters between China and the United States will benefit both nations, China's Vice Commerce Minister Wang Shouwen said on Friday.】

item.title: 更广泛的战争风险上升，黄金飙升，欧元下挫
item.description: 由于俄罗斯降低了使用核武器的门槛，并向乌克兰发射了一枚高超音速弹道导弹，周五黄金创下近八个月来的最大单周涨幅，欧元也在13个月低点徘徊。【原文：Gold was headed for its largest weekly gain in nearly eight months on Friday and the euro hovered at a 13-month low as Russia lowered its threshold for using nuclear weapons and fired a hypersonic ballistic missile at Ukraine.】

item.title: 乌克兰战争愈演愈烈，供应风险增加，石油上涨
item.description: 俄罗斯称已向乌克兰发射了一枚弹道导弹，并警告称冲突将扩大，这增加了原油供应收紧的前景，此后周五油价上涨。【原文：Oil prices rose on Friday after Russia said it had fired a ballistic missile at Ukraine and warned of a broadening conflict, raising the prospect of tightening crude supplies.】

item.title: 南华早报》报道：香港开发商新世界将专注于债务管理
item.description: 据《南华早报》（SCMP）报道，香港房地产开发商新世界发展（New World Development）董事长郑家纯表示，在考虑并购之前，新世界发展的目标是集中精力解决债务问题。【原文：Hong Kong property developer New World Development aims to focus on its debt load before any consideration of mergers or acquisitions, according to chairman Henry Cheng, the South China Morning Post reported (SCMP).】

item.title: 据 Axios 报道，DirecTV 将因债务交换终止与 Dish 的交易
item.description: 据《Axios》周四援引一位熟悉内情的人士的话报道，在债券持有人拒绝了该交易依赖的债务交换后，DirecTV 将终止对 Dish TV 的收购计划。【原文：DirecTV will terminate its planned acquisition of Dish TV after bondholders rejected a debt swap that the deal relied on, Axios reported on Thursday, citing a person familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 印度亿万富翁高塔姆-阿达尼涉嫌贿赂的计划是如何启动和展开的
item.description: 本文介绍了事件的发展过程，摘自检察官长达 54 页的刑事起诉书。【原文：This account of how it unfolded is drawn from prosecutors' 54-page criminal indictment.】

item.title: 市场等待美联储下一次暗示，美元逼近 13 个月峰值
item.description: 周五，美元接近13个月高点，因为投资者评估了美联储的利率路径前景，欧洲的不确定性也使欧元持续走低，而比特币则在觊觎100,000美元的水平。【原文：The U.S. dollar stuck close to a 13-month high on Friday as investors assessed the outlook for the Federal Reserve's interest rate path and uncertainty in Europe kept the euro on the back foot, while bitcoin eyed the $100,000 level.】

item.title: 印度大亨阿达尼在美国被起诉，投资者恐慌；债券再次下跌
item.description: 在亿万富翁阿达尼集团创始人高塔姆-阿达尼（Gautam Adani）因涉嫌诈骗被美国检方起诉并因涉嫌2.65亿美元的贿赂计划被发出逮捕令后，印度阿达尼集团债券周五连续第二个交易日承压。【原文：India's Adani Group bonds were under pressure for a second session Friday following billionaire founder Gautam Adani's indictment for fraud by U.S. prosecutors and arrest warrants issued for him over an alleged $265 million bribery scheme.】

item.title: 日本制造业采购经理人指数（PMI）显示，日本工厂活动因需求低迷而继续下滑
item.description: 周五进行的一项私营部门调查显示，由于对中国经济放缓的担忧和持续的成本压力导致需求低迷，11月份日本工厂活动连续第五个月萎缩。【原文：Japan's factory activity contracted for the fifth straight month in November due to sluggish demand caused by worries over China's economic slowdown and persistent cost pressures, a private-sector survey showed on Friday.】

item.title: 特朗普回归可能扩大美股对全球竞争对手的优势
item.description: 一些投资者认为，如果当选总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）能够在不陷入全面贸易战或联邦赤字膨胀的情况下实施其经济政纲，美国股市的领先优势可能会扩大。【原文：U.S. stocks are extending their lead over global peers and some investors believe that dominance could grow if President-elect Donald Trump can implement his economic platform without becoming mired in a full-blown trade war or ballooning the federal deficit.】

item.title: 日经新闻》报道：Couche-Tard 董事长称不会恶意收购 Seven & i 公司
item.description: 日经商业日报》（Nikkei business daily）援引加拿大收购方董事长兼联合创始人阿兰-布沙尔（Alain Bouchard）的话说，Alimentation Couche-Tard 没有考虑对日本 Seven & i 进行恶意收购。【原文：Alimentation Couche-Tard is not considering a hostile takeover bid for Japan's Seven & i , the Nikkei business daily quoted the Canadian suitor's chairman and co-founder, Alain Bouchard, as saying.】

item.title: 鸟击事件发生后，FAA 将召集委员会审查 737 MAX 发动机问题
item.description: 2023 年，美国西南航空公司（Southwest Airlines）的飞机发生了两起鸟击事件，联邦航空管理局（Federal Aviation Administration）计划在未来几周内召开纠正措施审查委员会会议，审议波音 737 MAX 飞机发动机的安全问题。【原文：The Federal Aviation Administration plans to convene a corrective action review board in the coming weeks to consider safety concerns about engines on Boeing 737 MAX airplanes after two bird strike incidents on Southwest Airlines planes in 2023.】

item.title: 波音公司获得价值 23.8 亿美元的合同，为美国空军增购 15 架 KC-46A 加油机
item.description: 波音公司周四表示，它已从美国空军获得一份价值23.8亿美元的合同，将根据第11批采购计划再建造15架KC-46A "飞马 "空中加油机。【原文：Boeing said on Thursday it has secured a $2.38 billion contract from the U.S. Air Force to build 15 additional KC-46A Pegasus aerial refueling tankers under the Lot 11 procurement.】

item.title: 日本 10 月核心通胀放缓，但仍高于日本央行目标
item.description: 日本 10 月份核心消费者价格同比上涨 2.3%，涨幅较 9 月份有所放缓，但继续超过央行设定的 2% 的目标，这表明进一步加息的条件正在逐步具备。【原文：Japan's core consumer prices in October rose 2.3% from a year earlier, slowing from September's pace but continuing to exceed the central bank's 2% target in a sign conditions for further interest rate hikes were falling in place.】
